p: The growth index of F. graminearum ZALF 24 and F. graminearum ZALF 339 varied and depended on the used oil and its concentration. The highest fungicidal activity with respect to both F. graminearum strains, regardless of the concentration, was shown by the geranium oil and the rosewood oil, which contain about 88â€“97% monoterpenoids. The development of the F. graminearum ZALF 24 strain was inhibited by the rosemary and lemon oils at concentrations from 0.5% to 2.0%, and F. graminearum ZALF 339 by a 1.0% concentration of lemon oil. All tested oils, compared to the control, reduced the rate of mycelial growth of Fusarium graminearum and showed fungistatic activity.
